elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the factual text "Import and export of Switzerland".

elements.name: question1
elements.title: What are Switzerland's most important trading partners?
elements.correctAnswer: Germany, Italy, France and the USA

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What are the names of the treaties with which Switzerland is seeking access to the European market?
elements.correctAnswer: Bilateral agreements between Switzerland and the EU

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What points were negotiated bilaterally with the EU?
elements.correctAnswer: Bilateral agreements I: movement of persons, air transport, land transport, agriculture, public procurement, technical barriers to trade, research; Bilateral agreements II: police cooperation (Schengen), asylum (Dublin), taxation of savings income, processed agricultural products, combating fraud, environment, pensions, media, statistics, education

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What role do foreign workers play in Switzerland?
elements.correctAnswer: Foreign workers make a decisive contribution to the well-being of the Swiss economy. Around 25 percent of all people living in Switzerland are foreign nationals.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: How do the foreign workers working in Switzerland today differ from the foreign workers in the 1960s?
elements.correctAnswer: In contrast to the 1960s, it is mainly highly qualified foreign workers who come to Switzerland.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: What is meant by economic globalization?
elements.correctAnswer: Aspects of economic globalization: World trade in goods is increasing. Production takes place where it is cheapest. The amount of capital being moved from one country to another is constantly increasing. Companies are relocating their headquarters abroad. Large corporations are the main participants in global trade. Markets are being opened up and barriers to trade removed. The companies that are active worldwide have more and more power. Politics and therefore national governments have become weaker.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Which major trading blocs in the global economy do you know?
elements.correctAnswer: NAFTA (USA/North America), EU and EEA (Europe), Japan and ASEAN countries (Asia), BRICS, MERCOSUR

elements.name: question8
elements.title: What is the purpose of the WTO?
elements.correctAnswer: The WTO aims to promote the trade of goods and services between nations and, to this end, to dismantle trade barriers. It also aims to protect intellectual property worldwide and secure access to public procurement markets.

elements.name: question9
elements.title: What are the three pillars of the WTO?
elements.correctAnswer: GATT (General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade), GATS (General Agreement on Trade and Services), TRIPS (Trade-related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights)
